title: SA to Volume of Rectangular Cells

content.question: (a) Identify the rectangular solid that represents the cell with the smallest amount of plasma membrane per volume of cytoplasm.

frqParts.text: (a) Identify the rectangular solid that represents the cell with the smallest amount of plasma membrane per volume of cytoplasm.
(b) Describe the relationship between the dimensions of the rectangular solids and their surface area-to-volume ratios.

(c) Using the data from the model, evaluate the hypothesis that cells shaped like rectangular solids <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> are better suited for slow metabolism and the long‑term storage of energy‑containing molecules than are cells shaped like rectangular solids <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
(d) Based on the trends shown in the data, explain why some rectangular cells include folds or projections in their plasma membranes.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
